column1: Acolyte: You have spent your life in the service of a temple to a specific god or pantheon of gods. You act as an intermediary between the realm of the holy and the mortal world
column2: performing sacred rites and offering sacrifices in order to conduct worshipers into the presence of the divine. You are not necessarily a cleric performing sacred rites is not the same thing as channeling divine power.

column1: Sage: You spent years learning the lore of the multiverse. You scoured manuscripts
column2: studied scrolls
column3: and listened to the greatest experts on the subjects that interest you. Your efforts have made you a master in your fields of study.

column1: Spy: Although your capabilities are not much different from those of a burglar or smuggler
column2: you learned and practiced them in a very different context: as an espionage agent. You might have been an officially sanctioned agent of the crown
column3: or perhaps you sold the secrets you uncovered to the highest bidder.

column1: Hermit: You lived in seclusion either in a sheltered community such as a monastery
column2: or entirely alone for a formative part of your life. In your time apart from the clamor of society
column3: you found quiet
column4: solitude
column5: and perhaps some of the answers you were looking for.

column1: Urban Bounty Hunter: Before you became an adventurer
column2: your life was already full of conflict and excitement
column3: because you made a living tracking down people for pay. Unlike some people who collect bounties
column4: though
column5: you aren't a savage who follows quarry into or through the wilderness. You're involved in a lucrative trade
column6: in the place where you live
column7: that routinely tests your skills and survival instincts. What's more
column9: as a bounty hunter in the wild would be: you routinely interact with both the criminal subculture and other bounty hunters
column10: maintaining contacts in both areas to help you succeed.

column1: Anthropologist: You have always been fascinated by other cultures
column2: from the most ancient and primeval lost lands to the most modern civilizations. By studying other cultures' customs
column3: philosophies
column4: laws
column5: rituals
column6: religious beliefs
column11: and all forms of society in between craft their own destinies and doom.

column1: Archaeologist: An archaeologist learns about the long-lost and fallen cultures of the past by studying their remains – their bones
column2: their ruins
column3: their surviving masterworks
column4: and their tombs. Those who practice archaeology travel to the far corners of the world to root through crumbled cities and lost dungeons
column5: digging in search of artifacts that might tell the stories of monarchs and high priests
column6: wars and cataclysms.

column1: City Watch: You have served the community where you grew up
column2: standing as its first line of defense against crime. You aren't a soldier
column3: directing your gaze outward at possible enemies. Instead
column4: your service to your hometown was to help police its populace
column5: protecting the citizenry from lawbreakers and malefactors of every stripe.

column1: Charlatan: You have always had a way with people. You know what makes them tick
column2: you can tease out their hearts' desires after a few minutes of conversation
column3: and with a few leading questions you can read them like they were children's books. It's a useful talent
column4: and one that you're perfectly willing to use for your advantage.

column1: Criminal: You are an experienced criminal with a history of breaking the law. You have spent a lot of time among other criminals and still have contacts within the criminal underworld. You’re far closer than most people to the world of murder
column2: theft
column3: and violence that pervades the underbelly of civilization
column4: and you have survived up to this point by flouting the rules and regulations of society.

column1: Entertainer: You thrive in front of an audience. You know how to entrance them
column2: entertain them
column3: and even inspire them. Your poetics can stir the hearts of those who hear you
column4: awakening grief or joy
column5: laughter or anger. Your music raises their spirits or captures their sorrow. Your dance steps captivate
column6: your humor cuts to the quick. Whatever techniques you use

column1: Feylost: You grew up in the Feywild after disappearing from your home plane as a child. Perhaps you were spirited away by kindly Fey who thought you were destined for great things. Perhaps you stumbled through a Fey crossing by chance during a twilight stroll in the woods. Perhaps you were kidnapped by evil Fey but escaped from their clutches. Whatever the manner of your disappearance
column2: you gradually fell under the Feywild's spell and learned a little about the nature of the mercurial tricksters that dwell there.

column1: Fisher: You have spent your life aboard fishing vessels or combing the shallows for the bounty of the ocean. Perhaps you were born into a family of fisher folk
column2: working with your kin to feed your village. Maybe the job was a means to an end - a way out of an undesirable circumstance that forced you to take up life aboard a ship. Regardless of how you began
column3: you soon fell in love with the sea
column4: the art of fishing
column5: and the promise of the eternal horizon.

column1: Folk Hero: You come from a humble social rank
column2: but you are destined for so much more. Already the people of your home village regard you as their champion
column3: and your destiny calls you to stand against the tyrants and monsters that threaten the common folk everywhere.

column1: Gambler: All you need to make a lot of gold is a little gold. Except at those times when all you need to have no gold at all is a little gold. Whether you're a good gambler or a bad one rarely matters
column2: because no one can divine the whims of Lady Luck. Sometimes you're up
column3: sometimes you're down. But the thing about gambling is that someone is always willing to take a bet.

column1: Gladiator: you’ve gained some fame (or the infamy) by participating in the sport of the armed combat and it is being pitted in the battle which is opposite to the other d&d gladiator backgrounds
column2: wild animals and also the magical beasts which always for the enjoyment of the masses. Of course
column3: sometimes these battles are preceded by the most competitions of the martial skill like the archery contests
column4: chariot or foot races
column5: through the dangerous obstacle courses.

column1: Haunted One: You are haunted by something so terrible that you dare not speak of it. You’ve tried to bury it and run away from it
column2: to no avail. Whatever this thing is that haunts you can’t be slain with a sword or banished with a spell. It might come to you as a shadow on the wall
column3: a bloodcurdling nightmare
column4: a memory that refuses to die
column5: or a demonic whisper in the dark. The burden has taken its toll
column6: isolating you from most people and making you question your sanity. You must find a way to overcome it before it destroys you.

column1: Guild Merchant: As an established and respected member of a guild
column2: you can rely on certain benefits that membership provides. Your fellow guild members will provide you with lodging and food if necessary
column3: and pay for your funeral if needed. In some cities and towns
column4: a guildhall offers a central place to meet other members of your profession
column5: which can be a good place to meet potential patrons
column6: allies

column1: Gruul Anarch: The entire world of Ravnica is a sprawling metropolis
column2: but you are a native of the wild areas that still exist - the abandoned districts
column3: the rubblebelts
column4: the overgrown parks
column5: and the crumbling ruins. You are part of a savage society that clings desperately to the Old Ways - attuned to nature
column6: full of primal rage
column7: and given short shrift by a world consumed with continuing civilization's march of progress.

column1: Knight of the Order: You belong to an order of knights who have sworn oaths to achieve a certain goal. The nature of this goal depends on the order you serve
column2: but in your eyes it is without question a vital and honorable endeavor. Faerûn has a wide variety of knightly orders
column3: all of which have a similar outlook concerning their actions and responsibilities.

column1: Mercenary Veteran: As a sell-sword who fought battles for coin
column2: you're well acquainted with risking life and limb for a chance at a share of treasure. Now
column3: you look forward to fighting foes and reaping even greater rewards as an adventurer. Your experience makes you familiar with the ins and outs of mercenary life
column4: and you likely have harrowing stories of events on the battlefield.

column1: Mage of High Sorcery: Your talent for magic came to the attention of the Mages of High Sorcery
column2: an organization of spellcasters that studies magic and prevent its misuse. You've trained among the Mages
column3: but whether you'll face the dangerous tests required to become a full member of the group remains to be determined.

column1: Noble: You understand wealth
column2: power
column3: and privilege. You carry a noble title
column4: and your family owns land
column5: collects taxes
column6: and wields significant political influence. You might be a pampered aristocrat unfamiliar with work or discomfort
column7: a former merchant just elevated to the nobility
column8: or a disinherited scoundrel with a disproportionate sense of entitlement. Or you could be an honest
column9: hard-working landowner who cares deeply about the people who live and work on your land
column10: keenly aware of your responsibility to them.

column1: Outlander: You grew up in the wilds
column2: far from civilization and the comforts of town and technology. You've witnessed the migration of herds larger than forests
column3: survived weather more extreme than any city-dweller could comprehend
column4: and enjoyed the solitude of being the only thinking creature for miles in any direction. The wilds are in your blood
column5: whether you were a nomad
column6: an explorer
column9: or even a marauder. Even in places where you don't know the specific features of the terrain
column10: you know the ways of the wild.

column1: Sailor: You sailed on a seagoing vessel for years. In that time
column2: you faced down mighty storms
column3: monsters of the deep
column4: and those who wanted to sink your craft to the bottomless depths. Your first love is the distant line of the horizon
column5: but the time has come to try your hand at something new.

column1: Rival Intern: You were an intern at a rival of Acquisitions Incorporated
column2: and you gained a healthy respect for not just the job and the franchising opportunities. but for the ruthless and efficient way Acquisitions Incorporated goes about its business. Why deal with the rest
column3: when you can work for the best?

column1: Rakdo's Cultist: You're an entertainer at heart
column2: a performer with a flair for the dramatic and a love of the spotlight. You've spent years honing your craft
column3: mastering a demanding set of skills so you can perform them with panache and make them look easy. The wild applause
column4: the screams of the crowds
column5: the mayhem and terror spreading into the streets - this is what you live for.

column1: Quadrix Student: In preparation to become a student of Quandrix College
column2: you have spent years working through the college's math problems for prospective students. Your interests concentrate on the mathematical principles and patterns found in the natural world. You might lean more toward mathematics or physics
column3: or you delve into more abstract studies of metaphysics
column4: arcana
column5: or logic.

column1: Prismari Student: You are an artist
column2: and you have been preparing to hone your craft according to the traditions of Prismari College. Whatever your medium-sculpture
column3: dance
column4: paint
column5: music
column6: drama
column8: or any other field-you have grand visions of bringing your art to life in a fusion of magic and creativity.

column1: Ruined: Everything was going so well! You had a life of luxury
column2: love
column3: and comfort when you suddenly lost it all. Perhaps you were framed for crimes you didn’t commit and lost your reputation
column4: fortune
column5: and career. Maybe a rampaging dragon or another monster wiped out everything you had in a single calamitous afternoon. Or you might have sought out a Deck of Many Things
column6: hoping to make your successful life even more glorious—only to draw a destructive card that changed your destiny forever.

column1: Rune Carver: You’ve dedicated your life to studying the practice of runecraft. Whether you were personally taught by a master rune carver or learned by poring over engravings in ancient ruins
column2: you understand how to tap into the supernatural power held within runes.

column1: Selesnya Initiate: You are a member of a blessed community
column2: built on the ideals of harmony. Here
column3: nature and civilization coexist peacefully
column4: living and growing in accordance with the will of the Worldsoul
column5: Mat'Selesnya. As a member of the Selesnya Conclave
column6: you are surrounded by people and other creatures who share your worldview and your longing for deeper spiritual communion with the world
column7: and you have a fervent desire to share the joy you have experienced with Ravnica. Along with the rest of the conclave
column8: you are committed to resisting the ambitions of the other guilds- with military force if necessary.

column1: Shipwright: You have sailed into war on the decks of great ships
column2: patching their hulls with soup bowls and prayers. You once helped build a fishing vessel that single-handedly saved a town from starvation. You have seen a majestic prow in your dreams that you have not been able to replicate in wood. Since childhood
column3: you have loved the water and have been captivated by the many vessels that travel on it.

column1: Silverquill Student: You have spent years practicing your writing and oration in the hope of becoming a student of Silverquill College. Your studies focus on language
column2: literature
column3: and the power of words
column4: both magical and otherwise. The metaphorical power of words to illuminate or conceal is joined with the literal ability of magic to do the same in your academic pursuits.

column1: Simic Scientist: Imagine a perfect world: one in which nature and civilization exist in harmony
column2: adapted to each other; one in which life is shaped to match its environment and the environment is shaped to match life. That's the world you have been trying to grow in the laboratories of the Simic Combine. Nature is all about adaptation
column3: evolution
column4: and balance - but for it to keep up with the pace of advancing civilization
column5: nature needs some help from biomancers and terraformers.

column1: Smuggler: On a rickety barge
column2: you carried a hundred longswords in fish barrels right past the dock master's oblivious lackeys. You have paddled a riverboat filled with stolen elven wine under the gaze of the moon and sold it for twice its value in the morning. In your more charitable times
column3: you have transported innocents out of war zones or helped guide herd animals to safety on the banks of a burning river.

column1: Soldier: War has been your life for as long as you care to remember. You trained as a youth
column2: studied the use of weapons and armor
column3: learned basic survival techniques
column4: including how to stay alive on the battlefield. You might have been part of a standing national army or a mercenary company
column5: or perhaps a member of a local militia who rose to prominence during a recent war.

column1: Urchin: You grew up on the streets alone
column2: orphaned
column3: and poor
column4: You had no one to watch over you or to provide for you
column5: so you learned to provide for yourself. You fought fiercely over food and kept a constant watch out for other desperate souls who might steal from you. You slept on rooftops and in alleyways
column6: exposed to the elements
column7: and endured sickness without the advantage of medicine or a place to recuperate. You've survived despite all odds

column1: Uthgardt Tribe Member: Though you might have only recently arrived in civilized lands
column2: you are no stranger to the values of cooperation and group effort when striving for supremacy. You learned these principles
column3: and much more
column4: as a member of an Uthgardt tribe. You might have grown up in one of the tribes that had decided to settle down
column5: and now that they have abandoned that path
column6: you find yourself adrift. Or you might come from a segment of the Uthgardt that adheres to tradition
column7: but you seek to bring glory to your tribe by achieving great things as a formidable adventurer.

column1: Waterdhavian Noble: You are a scion of one of the great noble families of Waterdeep. Human families who jealously guard their privilege and place in the City of Splendors
column2: Waterdhavian nobles have a reputation across Faerûn for being eccentric
column3: spoiled
column4: venal
column5: and
column6: above all else

column1: Wildspacer: You were raised in the void of Wildspace—home to asteroid miners
column2: moon farmers
column3: and other hardy folk. Perhaps you grew up in a far-flung settlement such as the Rock of Bral
column4: or you spent your early years on the crew of a spelljamming ship
column5: performing helpful chores such as swabbing the deck
column6: loading and offloading cargo
column7: and scraping barnacles off the hull. Whatever your history
column8: life in Wildspace has toughened you so well that you are as brave as a miniature giant space hamster when it comes to facing the terrors and other challenges of the airless night.

column1: Witchlight Hand: You crept into the Witchlight Carnival as a child or youth and never looked back
column2: earning a place among those who work behind the scenes to keep the carnival in business. As a hand
column3: you work hard and party hard. The carnival has borne you to many fantastic worlds
column4: circling back around to your home world once every eight years
column5: but you know almost nothing about these worlds because you spend all your time in the carnival. You know the other hands well
column6: but the carnival's owners-Mister Witch and Mister Light-remain mysterious to you even after all these years.

column1: Witherbloom Student: You filled your childhood with rudimentary alchemical experiments
column2: all in the hope of becoming a student of Witherbloom College. The life sciences are the focus of your reading
column3: which include biology and necromancy. Brewing strange concoctions with medicinal properties
column4: exploring the anatomies of monsters
column5: and cataloging swamp flora are the kinds of studies you might pursue at Witherbloom College.

column1: Plaintiff: You were a victim of a legal incident that was ostensibly the fault of Acquisitions Incorporated. At least that's what the local magistrate said. But before a final ruling could be handed down. Acquisitions Incorporated offered you a job! Don't know how to swing a sword? They promised to teach you! Think you have what it takes to sling spells? They've got masters who'll have you throwing fire in no time!
Planar Philosopher: You subscribe to a distinct philosophy that seeks to understand the nature of the planes or some hidden truth of the multiverse. You draw strength from your conviction and
column2: perhaps
column3: a network of like-minded believers. In your travels
column4: you seek to deepen the depths of your understanding and spread your philosophy.

column1: Orzhov Representative: The prospect of immense wealth is the promise of membership in the Orzhov Syndicate. All of the guild's endeavors channel wealth from Ravnican society into the ranks of the Orzhov - and concentrates the spoils at the top of the hierarchy. As a functionary in that system
column2: your best hope is to claim as much as possible of the money that passes through your hands on its way up
column3: so that you can work your way into a more prominent position. Regardless of your past and the wealth of your family
column4: your initial status with the guild is near the bottom
column5: until you have proven your value.

column1: Marine: You were trained for battle on sandy beaches and rocky shores. You have launched midnight raids from swift ships whose names evoke terror in the hearts of your adversaries. The water is your second home
column2: the rain your shelter
column3: and the crashing waves your battle cry.

column1: Knight of Solamnia: You have trained to be a valorous warrior known as a Knight of Solamnia. Strict rules guide your every action
column2: and you work to uphold them as you strive to defend the weak and oppose evil. Your honor is as important to you as your life.

column1: Investigator: You relentlessly seek the truth. Perhaps you're motivated by belief in the law and a sense of universal justice
column2: or maybe that very law has failed you and you seek to make things right. You could have witnessed something remarkable or terrible
column3: and now you must know more about this hidden truth. Or maybe you're a detective for hire
column4: uncovering secrets for well-paying clients. Whether the mysteries you're embroiled in are local crimes or realm-spanning conspiracies
column5: you're driven by a personal need to hunt down even the most elusive clues and reveal what others would keep hidden in the shadows.

column1: Inheritor: You are the heir to something of great value – not mere coin or wealth
column2: but an object that has been entrusted to you and you alone. Your inheritance might have come directly to you from a member of your family
column3: by right of birth
column4: or it could have been left to you by a friend
column5: a mentor
column6: a teacher
column7: or someone else important in your life. The revelation of your inheritance changed your life
column8: and might have set you on the path to adventure
column9: but it could also come with many dangers
column10: including those who covet your gift and want to take it from you – by force

column1: Golgari Agent: You are a member of a teeming horde - one small part of a sprawling organism. Just as you are part of the swarm
column2: the swarm is part of a larger ecosystem
column3: a never-ending cycle of life
column4: death
column5: rot
column6: and rebirth. You have spent your life in the slow churn of that ecosystem
column7: in the dark places of the city where the messy parts of existence are on display. There is little squeamishness among the Golgari
column8: no fear of death or taboo about the dead
column9: just a fierce affirmation of the cycle.

column1: Gate Warden: You spent a significant amount of time somewhere influenced by a portal to another plane of existence or by intense planar forces. You’re accustomed to experiences that would leave others reeling in terror or enraptured by otherworldly beauty
column2: and you’re as comfortable dealing with fiends and celestials as you are with vendors in town.

column1: Failed Merchant: Maybe you come from a long line of merchants. Perhaps you were an entrepreneur. Regardless. your ventures ended poorly. Whether it was because of outside influences
column2: bad luck
column3: or simply because your business acumen was weak
column4: you lost everything. With failure
column5: however. comes experience. You're free of that old life
column6: having made some connections and learned your lessons. Prepared to pursue the life of an adventurer
column7: your insight into the world of commerce brought you into the sphere of Acquisitions Incorporated - and a franchise just might be in your future.

column1: Faceless: Being who you are
column2: you could never be a hero. Whether due to your class
column3: your people
column4: your family
column5: or your sins
column6: something about you prevents you from effectively pursuing the path you've chosen. Even so
column7: that doesn't stop you. You've left your old face behind

column1: Courtier: You might have been one of the many functionaries
column2: attendants
column3: and other hangers-on in the Court of Silverymoon
column4: or perhaps you traveled in Waterdeep's baroque and sometimes cutthroat conglomeration of guilds
column5: nobles
column6: adventurers
column7: and secret societies. You might have been one of the behind-the-scenes law-keepers or functionaries in Baldur's Gate or Neverwinter
column8: or you might have grown up in and around the castle of Daggerford.
